info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 29 at 2:53PM MDT until August 30 at 1:00AM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: .Stronger winds will be funneled between competing pressure systems over our region this afternoon through Wednesday. The addition of hot temperatures, low relative humidity, and dry vegetation will all combine to create critical fire weather conditions. Any fire start would lead to rapid fire growth toward the northwest this evening. Around midnight, humidity will recover and winds will diminish slightly ahead of the approaching cold front. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM MDT WEDNESDAY FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 134, 135, 136, AND 137... The National Weather Service in Glasgow has issued a Red Flag Warning for dry fuels and gusty winds, which is in effect from 3 PM this afternoon to 1 AM MDT Wednesday. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zone 134 Northern Valley and Northern Phillips Counties, Fire Weather Zone 135 The Little Rockies, Fire Weather Zone 136 The Lower Missouri River Breaks including the Charles M Russell National Wildlife Refuge and Fire Weather Zone 137 Southern Petroleum and Southern Garfield Counties. * TIMING...This afternoon into early morning Wednesday. * WINDS...Southeast 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 11 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the low to mid 90s. * IMPACTS... These critical conditions would lead to rapid fire growth toward the northwest.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in these areas of this Red Flag Warning.
